s.html: Represents a time in seconds. Examples: 0s, 1.5s, -60s.
s.text: Represents a time in seconds. Examples: 0s, 1.5s, -60s.

ms.html: Represents a time in milliseconds. Examples: 0ms, 150.25ms, -60000ms.
ms.text: Represents a time in milliseconds. Examples: 0ms, 150.25ms, -60000ms.

%.html: The <percentage> CSS data type represents a percentage value. It is often used to define a size as relative to an element's parent object. Numerous properties can use percentages, such as width, height, margin, padding, and font-size.
%.text: The % (percentage) CSS data type represents a percentage value. It is often used to define a size as relative to an element's parent object. Numerous properties can use percentages, such as width, height, margin, padding, and font-size.

cap.html: Represents the "cap height" (nominal height of capital letters) of the element’s font.
cap.text: Represents the "cap height" (nominal height of capital letters) of the element’s font.

ch.html: Represents the width, or more precisely the advance measure, of the glyph "0" (zero, the Unicode character U+0030) in the element's font. In the cases where it is impossible or impractical to determine the measure of the "0" glyph, it must be assumed to be 0.5em wide by 1em tall.
ch.text: Represents the width, or more precisely the advance measure, of the glyph "0" (zero, the Unicode character U+0030) in the element's font. In the cases where it is impossible or impractical to determine the measure of the "0" glyph, it must be assumed to be 0.5em wide by 1em tall.

em.html: Represents the calculated font-size of the element. If used on the font-size property itself, it represents the inherited font-size of the element.
em.text: Represents the calculated font-size of the element. If used on the font-size property itself, it represents the inherited font-size of the element.

ex.html: Represents the x-height of the element's font. On fonts with the "x" letter, this is generally the height of lowercase letters in the font; 1ex ≈ 0.5em in many fonts.
ex.text: Represents the x-height of the element's font. On fonts with the "x" letter, this is generally the height of lowercase letters in the font; 1ex ≈ 0.5em in many fonts.

ic.html: Equal to the used advance measure of the "水" (CJK water ideograph, U+6C34) glyph found in the font used to render it.
ic.text: Equal to the used advance measure of the "水" (CJK water ideograph, U+6C34) glyph found in the font used to render it.

lh.html: Equal to the computed value of the line-height property of the element on which it is used, converted to an absolute length.
lh.text: Equal to the computed value of the line-height property of the element on which it is used, converted to an absolute length.

rem.html: Represents the font-size of the root element (typically <html>). When used within the root element font-size, it represents its initial value (a common browser default is 16px, but user-defined preferences may modify this).
rem.text: Represents the font-size of the root element (typically <html>). When used within the root element font-size, it represents its initial value (a common browser default is 16px, but user-defined preferences may modify this).

rlh.html: Equal to the computed value of the line-height property on the root element (typically <html>), converted to an absolute length. When used on the font-size or line-height properties of the root element, it refers to the properties' initial value.
rlh.text: Equal to the computed value of the line-height property on the root element (typically <html>), converted to an absolute length. When used on the font-size or line-height properties of the root element, it refers to the properties' initial value.

vh.html: Equal to 1% of the height of the viewport's initial containing block.
vh.text: Equal to 1% of the height of the viewport's initial containing block.

vw.html: Equal to 1% of the width of the viewport's initial containing block.
vw.text: Equal to 1% of the width of the viewport's initial containing block.

vi.html: Equal to 1% of the size of the initial containing block, in the direction of the root element’s inline axis.
vi.text: Equal to 1% of the size of the initial containing block, in the direction of the root element’s inline axis.

vb.html: Equal to 1% of the size of the initial containing block, in the direction of the root element’s block axis.
vb.text: Equal to 1% of the size of the initial containing block, in the direction of the root element’s block axis.

vmin.html: Equal to the smaller of vw and vh.
vmin.text: Equal to the smaller of vw and vh.

vmax.html: Equal to the larger of vw and vh.
vmax.text: Equal to the larger of vw and vh.

px.html: One pixel. For screen displays, it traditionally represents one device pixel (dot). However, for printers and high-resolution screens, one CSS pixel implies multiple device pixels. 1px = 1/96th of 1in.
px.text: One pixel. For screen displays, it traditionally represents one device pixel (dot). However, for printers and high-resolution screens, one CSS pixel implies multiple device pixels. 1px = 1/96th of 1in.

Q.html: One quarter of a millimeter. 1Q = 1/40th of 1cm.
Q.text: One quarter of a millimeter. 1Q = 1/40th of 1cm.

deg.html: Represents an angle in degrees. One full circle is 360deg. Examples: 0deg, 90deg, 14.23deg.
deg.text: Represents an angle in degrees. One full circle is 360deg. Examples: 0deg, 90deg, 14.23deg.

grad.html: Represents an angle in gradians. One full circle is 400grad. Examples: 0grad, 100grad, 38.8grad.
grad.text: Represents an angle in gradians. One full circle is 400grad. Examples: 0grad, 100grad, 38.8grad.

rad.html: Represents an angle in radians. One full circle is 2π radians which approximates to 6.2832rad. 1rad is 180/π degrees. Examples: 0rad, 1.0708rad, 6.2832rad.
rad.text: Represents an angle in radians. One full circle is 2π radians which approximates to 6.2832rad. 1rad is 180/π degrees. Examples: 0rad, 1.0708rad, 6.2832rad.

turn.html: Represents an angle in a number of turns. One full circle is 1turn. Examples: 0turn, 0.25turn, 1.2turn.
turn.text: Represents an angle in a number of turns. One full circle is 1turn. Examples: 0turn, 0.25turn, 1.2turn.

fr.html: The <flex> CSS data type denotes a flexible length within a grid container. It is used in grid-template-columns, grid-template-rows and other related properties.
fr.text: The <flex> CSS data type denotes a flexible length within a grid container. It is used in grid-template-columns, grid-template-rows and other related properties

dpi.html: Represents the number of dots per inch. Screens typically contains 72 or 96 dots per inch, but the dpi for printed documents is usually much greater. As 1 inch is 2.54 cm, 1dpi ≈ 0.39dpcm.
dpi.text: Represents the number of dots per inch. Screens typically contains 72 or 96 dots per inch, but the dpi for printed documents is usually much greater. As 1 inch is 2.54 cm, 1dpi ≈ 0.39dpcm.

dpcm.html: Represents the number of dots per centimeter. As 1 inch is 2.54 cm, 1dpcm ≈ 2.54dpi.
dpcm.text: Represents the number of dots per centimeter. As 1 inch is 2.54 cm, 1dpcm ≈ 2.54dpi.

dppx.html: Represents the number of dots per px unit. Due to the 1:96 fixed ratio of CSS in to CSS px, 1dppx is equivalent to 96dpi, which corresponds to the default resolution of images displayed in CSS as defined by image-resolution.
dppx.text: Represents the number of dots per px unit. Due to the 1:96 fixed ratio of CSS in to CSS px, 1dppx is equivalent to 96dpi, which corresponds to the default resolution of images displayed in CSS as defined by image-resolution.

x.html: Alias for dppx, which represents the number of dots per px unit. Due to the 1:96 fixed ratio of CSS in to CSS px, 1dppx is equivalent to 96dpi, which corresponds to the default resolution of images displayed in CSS as defined by image-resolution.
x.text: Alias for dppx, which represents the number of dots per px unit. Due to the 1:96 fixed ratio of CSS in to CSS px, 1dppx is equivalent to 96dpi, which corresponds to the default resolution of images displayed in CSS as defined by image-resolution.

number.html: The <number> CSS data type represents a number, being either an integer or a number with a fractional component.
number.text: The number CSS data type represents a number, being either an integer or a number with a fractional component.
